Articles.Content: That and your volumetric fog, you're going to blow our minds. Wouldn't you also, per chance, have up your sleeve a fix for KSP to use moar memory ?

Mod the terrain as like loading meshes with props ? Or is it modding the colors only?

Modding the terrain shader. Ie. changing the textures, getting rid of the mun repetition, re-using the Scaled Space texture as a high-orbit overlay, etc.

Well ATM is in use, but with Sonic's stuff and the many mods I have... I still encounter memory crash. I'm gonna get rid of a few big textures from TexReplacer.... And maybe Sonic

Sound adds a good bit to the memory usage. Are you using basic or aggressive ATM? Aggressive is much more erm... aggressive with textures and beats many more MB out of them.

I have a few ideas about the ocean lag (& how to save memory) but I want to get the terrain done first.

Would that be complementary to the planetary aspects of Texture Replacer or something that... umm... replaces it?

Complimentary. Right now, TR doesn't touch terrain at all. So when you would use TR to change the orbit texture, it would also enhance the ground as well. (think Moho and all those tiny planets that look like garbage up close compared to the replaced versions)

Hmmm... was it still at Laythe? Did you get the log right after it happened? This is with volumes disabled?

Duna this time, Yes, it was from a layer that had it disabled, but at the time it still had them on even when i disabled them.

Vixiea: you need the low-res version. That's symptomatic of your graphics card not supporting 8192x4096 textures.
